name: single superphosphate production | single superphosphate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23739/documentation

The dataset has been scaled to represent a single superphosphate production with a P2O5 content equal to 21%. ;Single superphosphate is the product of the reaction between phosphate rock and sulphuric acid. The phosphate must be converted to water-soluble monocalcium, as this process allows retention of the calcium phosphate in the product.;References:  Davis J. and Haglund C. (1999) Life Cycle Inventory (LCI) of Fertiliser Production - fertiliser products used in Sweden and Western Europe. Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg, Sweden, SIK-report no. 654.;Nemecek T. & Kägi T. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report ecoinvent V2.0 No. 15a. Agroscope Reckenholz-Taenikon Research Station ART, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Zurich and Dübendorf, CH, retrieved from: www.ecoinvent.ch.

The unit process inventory takes into account the production of single superphosphate from sulphuric acid and rock phosphate. Transports of raw materials and intermediate products to the fertiliser plant were included as well as the transport of the fertiliser product from the factory to the regional department store. Production and waste treatment of catalysts, coating and packaging of the final fertiliser products were not included. Infrastructure was included by means of a proxy module.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Year when reference used for this inventory was published.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is a weighted average built from the following geographies: RER.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Values given in the reference originate from manufacturers and/or other data sources which in turn refer to the real situation and hence are largely secured. However, the emissions factors may be somewhat uncertain. When no information on the speciation of  P- and F -emissions was given in the reference, the most likely speciation was assessed by an expert. For particulate emissions factors into the air specified only as the total particle mass in the reference, particle size distribution was assessed based on an expert's guess.

exchanges.description: The exchange has been scaled to represent the production of single superphosphate instead of a pure form of P2O5. The exchange has been divided with the scaling key of circa 4.76 kg of single superphosphate per kg of P2O5. Original amount of the exchange was: 1 kg of inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5.
